content:
When I click on the "Implementation Guide Registry" link at the bottom of http://www.hl7.org/fhir/index.html
my browser gets redirected to http://fhir-org.fhir-ehws.net.au/guides/registry/ which is a "server not found".
Some server problem, @Grahame Grieve ?
it's a server problem and it's killing me.
@Stefan Lang you can finde them here: https://www.fhir.org/guides/registry/
I know, but I still think the link in the spec should work :-)
I think so too. But the server doesn't think it should work, and no one can figure out why
we're trying to find some resources to move to a new server that is more supportable...
Maybe some weird proxy in the way?
no it's in the server. a request to http://server/folder will be redirected to http://server/folder/ - that's totally standard.

but this server, for reason known only to itself, issues an redirect to some other server. No one knows why, and the other server it redirects to is not anywhere in it's configuration. So we're ata loss, and the hosting service provider simply says that it's not their problem
we need to move it to a standard LAMP server in a cloud that we actually manage rather than being at the end of a long chain of support redirections. but that requires resources....
resources for moving, or resources for the server?
moving. I can stick up a LAMP server in a VM no problem

Resources for moving is an issue ...

Meanwhile for the current server: did you check /etc/hosts and maybe even /etc/hostname ?
Or grep the whole /etc for the ...fhir-ewts... thing?
I don't have access to something like that
Oh - that's indeed a reason to switch servers
